Early Access Review
								First off, let me say that the trailer for this game is unreliable and borerlines false advertisement. PLEASE keep in mind what you see in that trailer is NOWHERE NEAR comparable to your in game experience. In fact, I will go so far as to say that until the game is built in the manner the trailer portrays it...the trailer should be removed.This game has potential, but I cannot recommend it at it's current asking price. At least not yet. The single player is nothing more than a sandbox mode. I'm not sure if it's automatically online and I can't seem to find a multiplayer option in the menus anywhere. I've played for about 9 minutes, my experience in such a short time wasn't too great and was even enough to decide this game is just not what it portrays itself to be. I know, 9 minutes is hardly enough time for some users to judge a game with....that is if you're new to gaming. (lol. Please, a gamer who knows his or her salt will know instantly what's junk and what's gold).Upon starting I liked that I was given a knife, pistol and a car. I could have also kept the house I spawned in if I wanted to but decided to venture out. I drove up the road in the car and started taking damage. I got out and took cover and suddenly a random NPC appeared for about 2 seconds then glitched and disappeared. I stopped taking damage up until I explored an empty house, something was shooting at me but I couldnt identify it. It was able to shoot through walls and any cover I tried to take. No matter how far I ran whatever it was damaged me until I finally died.Wilflife NPC's look pretty poor. The wolves walk in a very fixed and stiff pattern like WoW when they should wander naturally. Also, wolves in the wild don't usually keep that close to civilization do they? Like literally in backyards?The AI is terrible and glitches, you'll get shot at by nothing and seemingly no one at all. Don't bother taking cover, whatever it is can shoot through hills, cars, trees, houses. Pretty much just stand still and die when you begin taking damage. NPC's disappear after you kill them. No blood or bodies left.Never got to see any building or crafting as of yet because I only got to explore one house before some unidentifiable hostile killed me by shooting me through a giant rock.There is NO storyline whatsoever. You spawn in a random house, and that's it.I would have liked to see more of this game, but every time I spawned I would die in this same fashion. This was every time I drove into town. It was annoying enough among everything else to quit. I hope I can get a refund for this until the game improves.The only thing about this game so far that I can say is positive is the performance. It runs smoothly and the graphics are nice. But the game needs MUCH more than that to be worth 15$At the moment, I cannot say it's worth it until the devs fix it.

								This game has extreme potential, not going to lie. The dev (1 I believe) actually listens to your feedback. This game is in its early stages, but I'm already excited to see how this turns out.Pros (As of now)- A pretty big world, from what I can tell- The animations, there are actually animations- Actual AI that don't charge through walls- The game looks nice, just not a lot of grass (future updates?)- NO ZOMBIES- Good gun textures- There is a car, wonky, but hey, faster then running wouldn't you say?Now for the cons, (none are game-breaking)- I can't seem to drop items? Maybe I'm just missing it though, Accidently grabbed two pistols.- You seem to get stuck on the door ways- When I open the inventory, the game pauses (It is "I", correct?)- Multiplayer doesn't have a chat button! (Prophet you joined my game, but I couldn't say hello!! :( )Not a con, just a question, I can't seem to find the big city, like the one in the startup menu?Overall, the game has a neat concept to it, and I thoroughly believe the game will get much better.  The developer seems to be very commited to the game, as he has roughly 300 hours into the game.  Keep in mind, if you buy this game, you are in no way getting a finished product, but it is actually playable, and quite enjoyable I must say.  If you have a couple of bucks to spend on the game, go for it. I know I will continue to help the dev make this game better, and more polished! Great work Prophet :)
